poem:
**Crossing the Invisible Line**

The morning paper spills ink, a tale  
of shadows slipping through the mist,  
bodies stitched with hope, cloth of longing,  
smugglers weaving promises across  
an unseen seam of land, Ireland's border—  
prices whispered like ghost notes,  
€8,000 for the passage, the hush,  
the solemn crossing to another light.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Hundreds detained in Northern Ireland in crackdown on people smugglers Hundreds of people have been detained in Northern Ireland trying to get into Great Britain by crossing the border from Ireland in an operation aimed at cracking down on people smugglers. Criminal gangs are charging up to €8,000 for the illegal travel package they present as a safer route to crossing the Channel on small boats , say immigration officials. The interceptions in Northern Ireland". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
